data.title: Best Rueben In Eugene
data.text:
I have reviewed this establishment in the past.  This may be my third visit.  

Arriving around noon I was visiting with a Groupon Coupon.  When I mentioned my coupon the server said "That is great have a seat and I will be right with you."  She arrived immediately, told me the specials, and suggested that I might want to consider the happy hour brew specials. (Some venue's will not let you use the happy hour specials with a groupon)

Ordering my favorite Micro and a Rueben sandwich was a wise choice.  The Rueben is my all time favorite and Good Times does it right!  A little more meat than I usually like but who complains about that?  The fries were cooked perfectly and a large portion.

A friend had the fish and chips.  I would skip the fish and chips and go for a burger or sandwich.

Good food and great service.

Bathrooms and booth were spotless.  Easy access to city bus stop.

data.title: Good Food
data.text: The food and drinks are well priced, but the only reason for giving it 3 stars is the service is very slow. If you need anything you will have to go to the bar and wait for the bartender to order food and drinks. Never seen a waiter/wateriest the whole time we were seated. But if you don't mind the wait the food tasted great.

data.title: Fun stop
data.text: We had seen Good Times from the highway and had to stop. Great little bar with an outside area to accommodate more fun! Pool and video lottery are a few things to do while drinking a beer (they have 32 on tap at any given time) or your fave cocktail. They serve food but we didn't eat. I have to say, Mike made the visit even better!

data.title: Great weekend Bloody Mary Bar
data.text: Better than average bar food.  We generally eat there on weekend mornings because we love their Bloody Mary bar - they have pickled asparagus, artichoke hearts, BACON, and lots more to spice up your drink!  Also recommend their chicken fried steak breakfast...it is huge.  All the employees are friendly and helpful.  We had a large group (13) and the kitchen manager came out to tell us that because of their small grill, he wanted to do a several meals at a time, then a few more, so that everyone had a hot breakfast.  Appreciated that a lot.  I think they only do breakfast on the weekends.

data.title: There is really nothing worth mentioning.
data.text: This appears to be a neighborhood watering hole.  The food is typical bar fare.  The drinks are not expensive, but the pour is less than generous.  Inside it looks like a typical bar.  The outdoor seating offers a view of a parking lot for government employees.  There are simply too many other places to go.

data.title: Great Bus Ride Location
data.text:
Casual pub atmosphere with a large outside sitting area.  The problem being if you prefer to sit outside be prepared for the area to be filled with smoke.

My lunch partner and I ordered two sandwiches.  Mine was the French dip.  When the sandwiches were completed a kitchen staffer came out to say that the cook had added cheese and mushrooms to my sandwich.  I was given the option of having another sandwich prepared or accepting the one with mushrooms and cheese at no extra charge for the cheese or mushrooms.  While I did not enjoy the cheese or mushrooms I did not like the option of having my lunch partner eat his sandwich prepared correctly and waiting for my sandwich to be re-done.  I made the decision to accept the incorrect sandwich.

It would be my suggestion that in the future the staffer offer the incorrect sandwich at no charge.  I ended up paying for a sandwich I did not care for so that I could eat at the same time as my lunch date.

The bar staff service was great and professional.

data.title: Drinks before the game
data.text: We stopped here for drinks before the game. The prices were very reasonable and they have plenty of great beers on tap.  If it's nice, try to sit on the patio.

data.title: The food was good, they lost 3 of 4 orders
data.text: We have eaten here several times.  The food is good for bar food.  Service is ok.  The last time we ate their with friends we ordered and they brought out our appetizer and a little while later one of our party got their burger.  We waited a little and no food for the other three of us.  The person with the burger was done by the time the rest of us got our food.  They said they lost part of our order.  That can happen.  Although they should have asked when we got the  burger if we had all ordered food.  We got no apology,  just kind of that is just the way it is.  Poor business.
